Research & Contact Lead Quickly


Research for any Active Opportunities and Online Presence:

·   Ensure Lead Contact is not in an Active Opportunity

  • Visit the Website to learn about their business
  • Look them up on social media to get tips on how best to connect, engage, and build rapport


Contact a new Lead as soon as possible:

  • The sooner you contact a New Lead the higher the likelihood of getting them to an FA
  • Obtain/Verify basic contact info to ensure accuracy

Actions to be performed on the day your First Appointment with the Prospect is Booked

Create Task to:

  • Send meeting reminder to Prospect
  • Email important notes to AE/Partner (Based on Record Type)


Meeting Day: During Meeting 


  • Make introductions
  • Recap previous conversations
  • Allow Prospect to clarify/add before turning to AE/Partner.
  • Capture new information in the notes section of Lead.
  • Ensure meeting wraps with next steps for all.


Meeting Day: After Meeting


  • Send thank-you note reminding Prospect of next steps
  • Take other actions as appropriate


If Converting Lead to Opportunity


  • If no Account exists for the company create an Account with NCR by submitting a request (input link to CDM Portal)
  • Congrats!

Remember: Your Prospect is looking for a High Value - Low Regret Deal


  • Gartner states Prospect will spend 62% of their time learning about NCR and our competitors before you'll have the chance to speak with them
  • Prospect will be overwhelmed with information
  • Mission: Gain intel about their Business while beginning to help them unpack "information complexity" with the goal of scheduling the First Appointment


Pro Tips:


  • Determine questions Prospect needs to ask themselves and their current suppliers
  • Identify what matters most in their buying decision
  • Identify consistent patterns of themes that surface during conversation regardless of origin


Learn:


  • Are they the decision maker?
  • Is their ask defined?
  • Do they have a budget?
  • What is their timeline to have a solution in place?
